issue.name: Cross-site scripting (reflected)
issue.issueBackground: Reflected cross-site scripting vulnerabilities arise when data is copied from a request and echoed into the application's immediate response in an unsafe way.
issue.remediationBackground: Input should be validated as strictly as possible. Output encoding should be applied.
issue.issueDetail: The application reflects the value of the q parameter in the response.
issue.vulnerabilityClassifications: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation

requestresponse.response:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: text/html
<html><body>Search results for: <script>alert(1)</script></body></html>

issue.name: SQL injection
issue.issueBackground: SQL injection vulnerabilities arise when user-controllable data is incorporated into database SQL queries in an unsafe manner.
issue.remediationBackground: Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection.
issue.issueDetail: The id parameter appears to be vulnerable to SQL injection.

issue.name: TLS certificate
issue.issueBackground: The server presented a TLS certificate.
